Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: maybe I missed it but are there any plans to make some easy api for marketmaker so that it could be backbone for shapshift-like services, meaning such service would only make the ui and plug to marketmaker? end user doing payment from blockchain would see different blockchains and fees dependent on spread based on marketmaker values ? or it is what is acually is already and just needs more marketing towards payment processing services ?

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: it would be great to attract all those services doing btc payments - they would provide liquidity and get liquidity; what could attract them would be easy quick implementation/connection to mm

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
I'll answer what I know: yes – it's called AtomicAPI. The full release is still coming but there is documentation already online

https://developers.atomicdex.io/basic-docs/atomicdex/atomicdex-api.html

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: would be great to see MM based payment service, where you could specify outgoing addr, amount, currency, and send your preferred currency in relevant amount; that would need to include some buy/sell walls fluctuations to make it mostly instant; probably would need few steps: **1. user fills in outgoing parameters 2. user gets back the amounts (included spread and spread fluctuations) needed from different currencies he owns in the wallet  3. user selects and query selected options 4. if tx is not instantly taken - the form gives back updated values doubleing the spread fluctuations - this way after 2-3 interations there tx should pass through** (user friendly during bigger fluctuations)

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: additionally if the tx will cost less due to fluctuations - the remaining change could stay on user side not to overpay

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: actually this could be built in into  atomic dex, and since in there (form + request functions) could maybe be easily ported to external services

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: now imagine you see as payment BCH QR code - you just click it using Atomic DEX app - already got step 1 done - outgoing params and instantly get the options from your wallet (and the taking the qr code shot could fire step 1 and 2 instantly), then you click selected option (pay if succesful) and see the feedback (paid or updated form in case of bigger fluctuation just happened)

Author: passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋#0622
Content: that would be an ultimate payment app

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi, in your Medium article on FSM  it says `For blockchains with DTO...`, what is the DTO that Komodo uses?  It wouldn't be a  tx, as all blockchains have that, would it?
(`https://medium.com/@jameslee777/how-to-implement-finite-state-machines-into-a-cc-8dfeadccbcad`)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://medium.com/@jameslee777/decentralized-trustless-oracles-dto-by-piggybacking-on-timestamp-consensus-rules-2adce34d67b6

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @CrisF jl777.com is quite useful

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: 👀 wow, thanks @jl777c !  💎

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
This brings me back to a question from #cc-oracles.
I've been going to conferences, presentations and talks over the last couple of months and Oracles are mentioned often, as something new.  One project made their full presentation on them at the start of blockchain week explaining how they were making theirs. Pretty much all Ethereum-based projects.  The audience was impressed.
Your post is from April and we tested Oracles in Labs over a year ago (Smk762 created DragonHound).
Are they really that far behind, or am I missing something?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why is it surprising komodo is years ahead?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: having the core code is just the start though, you need the docs and then GUI and end user services, all those require a lot of time and effort, but without the core functionality, no amount of docs and GUI can make an end user service

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if only komodo had hundred million to spend, then we could make a dozen projects worth of end user services, all decentralized.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you look at my jl777.com in detail, you will see that i have written about a large spectrum of blockchain tech and a lot of this has been in komodo for years, i just didnt bother to blog it till about six months ago

Author: Sarahz#0662
Content: Oracle can be implemented to blockchain kmd

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: from a blog post detailing a design, to working code to user friendly GUI and working end user service, that might take a year or two, but fundamentally, all the blockchain level issues are solved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all smartchains can have oracles enabled, DTO is a separate mechanism that requires a custom chain for specific oracle feeds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: komodo uses a multichain architecture so we can scale without having any single dapp bogging down the entire ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and yes, many oracles have already been implemented

Author: Sarahz#0662
Content: Good 👌

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: DTO is the most reliable oracles resistant to fake data and it forms the basis of several other solutions, like the decentralized stablecoins, whose conversion price is based on DTO, all blockchain based

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are working on an improvement that will allow any publicly avaiable api endpoint to be used as the source of the data. this then goes through a process to minimize the impact of biasing attacks and creates a consensus 24 hour price that is used for settlements

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still a bit of custom code will be needed to parse the data from an arbitrary feed, but that is all that would need to be done, so once that release is out, i expect we can see a lot more DTO chains. built in support for 32 fiats, binance cryptos and stockmarket prices, so for most prices the support is already there. maybe we need to document it better. @gcharang

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
That's my lack of perspective. Now I'm getting out and researching what business is looking for in gaining a clearer picture of where we are. I thought that big business would have more of a clue than I do.  
I've asked a few times to different people if Komodo is interested in corporate inquiries but not had a response. 
Opportunities to be had in my location.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: komodo is an open source project, if any companies are interested to use the komodo tech, they are certainly welcome to

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: From agama, how many can you mine at the same time by setgenerate?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: _will unstick them in a little while if no one else gets to it 1st_

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Only one chain per instance prolly?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: fwiw, DEX and SN were GPU mined a ton when BarterDex was actively being used

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Could be a good idea to teach the general public they can mine AC’s themselves from agama

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Plenty of people that wouldnt mind spending some company time and power running a full node at work 😃

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: And getting some tiny DEX’s here and there

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @Cryptoon most ACs are "on demand" which means that absent a transaction in the mempool Agama will not mine the chains no matter what you tell it

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: But once a block enters the mempool agama can mine it, right?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: transaction, not block

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: on-demand chains, by default, do not have empty blocks

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: blocks are only created when there's a demand for a block (when a transaction needs to be processed)

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Ok, but the cpu running agama wont run at however % if there are no tx presenting themselves?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: There is special software to "get around" that, but that's how it's designed to work

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: @Cryptoon in Agama you could mine with any native wallet simultaneously. I can't say it'll be efficient though

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`but the cpu running agama wont run at however % if there are no tx presenting themselves?`
correct, no tx = no mining

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Only when a tx present itself a block needs to be solved and agama will boost cpu to solve it?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Ok cool

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: @𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠 wouldnt be to make money, but to support the chains

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: It doesn't "boost" it, it literally just waits for a tx before doing anything

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Boost probably wrong choice of words

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
It's not an answer to the original question, but....
If chains do get stuck because of diff, there are several of use that can "unstick" them; one just needs to ask...
